gov.nasa.arc.mct.services.component
Class ComponentTypeInfo

java.lang.Object
  gov.nasa.arc.mct.services.component.ComponentTypeInfo
Direct Known Subclasses:
ExternalComponentRegistryImpl.ExtendedComponentTypeInfo
public class ComponentTypeInfo
extends java.lang.Object

This class describes an component type. This description is used in the platform to create new component type instances both through the UI as well as programmatically.

ComponentTypeInfo

public ComponentTypeInfo(java.lang.String displayName,
                         java.lang.String description,
                         java.lang.Class<? extends AbstractComponent> componentClass)
Creates new ComponentTypeInfo representing a unique component type.

Parameters:
displayName - non null human readable name for the component type
description - human readable string describing the component type
componentClass - non null component class, this class must provide the required no-argument constructor

ComponentTypeInfo

                         java.lang.String description,
                         java.lang.Class<? extends AbstractComponent> componentClass,
                         boolean isCreatable)
Creates new ComponentTypeInfo representing a unique component type.

Parameters:
displayName - non null human readable name for the component type
description - human readable string describing the component type
componentClass - non null component class, this class must have a no argument constructor
isCreatable - indicates if this component type is creatable under the Create menu.

ComponentTypeInfo

protected ComponentTypeInfo(java.lang.String displayName,
                            java.lang.String description,
                            java.lang.Class<? extends AbstractComponent> componentClass,
                            java.lang.String id,
                            boolean isCreatable,
                            CreateWizardUI wizard,
                            javax.swing.ImageIcon icon)
                     throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
Creates a new ComponentTypeInfo representing a unique component type.

Parameters:
displayName - non null human readable name for the component type
description - human readable string describing the component type
componentClass - non null component class, this class must have a no argument constructor
id - globally unique identifier (across all modules) identifying this component.
isCreatable - indicates if this component type can be created from the Create menu.
wizard - creates the panel to be displayed for the dialog box
icon - the icon that represents this component type
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if componentClass, id, or displayName is null or if component class does not meet the requirements of AbstractComponent
Method Detail

getComponentClass

public final java.lang.Class<? extends AbstractComponent> getComponentClass()
Returns the component class.

Returns:
component class of this component type

getDisplayName

public final java.lang.String getDisplayName()
Returns the human readable name of the component. This string will be shown in the user interface in labels and menus, so this should be short and internationalized.

Returns:
a string representing the name of the component type (not instance)

getShortDescription

public final java.lang.String getShortDescription()
Returns the human readable description of the component. This string will be shown in the user interface for a more descriptive representation of a component (tool tips...) and should be internationalized.

Returns:
string representing a description of the component type (not instance)

getId

public final java.lang.String getId()
Returns a unique id for this component type. The id must be unique and stable for the component type across all installations.

Returns:
component type id

isCreatable

public final boolean isCreatable()
Returns if this component type can be created through the New menu.

Returns:
if this component type is creatable.

getWizardUI

public final CreateWizardUI getWizardUI()
Returns wizard providing UI and action performed after creating. If null, a default wizard is used.

Returns:
wizard for UI

getIcon

public final javax.swing.ImageIcon getIcon()
Returns the image icon that represents this component type.

Returns:
icon for component type
